column3: JPja
column4: USen

column3:
あぁ…"怖ろしい…
まるで悪夢のよう…
column4: So terrifying... A real nightmare...

column3:
魔物が去るまでは
まだ じっとしていた方が…
column4:
Maybe it would be better to just stay put
until the monsters leave...

column3:
私…なんとか助かったんですね？
どうやらここは天国ではなさそうですし…
column4:
You...you saved me! I mean, unless I'm
in heaven right now...

column3:
巡礼の旅…先が少し不安です
もちろん引き返すつもりはありませんけど…
column4:
This journey... I'm feeling a bit uneasy
about what lies ahead. Still, I refuse to
give up!

column3:
早く お逃げください！
ガーディアンに見つからないように！
column4:
Run away! Hurry, you must escape!
Don't let the Guardian see you!

column3:
ゼルダという名のお姫様…
あなたは ご存じですか？
おとぎ話の中ではなくて
ハイラルの地に実在したお姫様です
私は そのゼルダ姫が かつて巡礼した地を
こうして ゆっくりと辿っているのです
column4:
The princess named Zelda...
Do you know of her?

She's not just a fairy tale. She was a
princess who actually existed in the
land of Hyrule.
In fact, I'm retracing Princess Zelda's
footsteps, trying to find the locations
where she journeyed way back when.
I think I'm probably moving a lot slower
than she did, though...

column3:
ゼルダ姫はご存じですか？

私彼女が巡礼した地を辿ってるんです
彼女は各地で何を感じていたのか…
column4:
Do you know about Princess Zelda?


I'm retracing her steps to visit the places
she journeyed to. I wonder what she was
feeling at each of these locations...

column3:
…私ですか？
ゼルダ姫の足跡を辿る旅の途中です
次の巡礼地は ラネール山にある知恵の泉…
ゼルダ姫は そこで何を得たのでしょう
column4:
Who, me? I'm just a traveler trying to
retrace Princess Zelda's footsteps and
re-create her journey.
My next stop is the Spring of Wisdom at
Mount Lanayru. What might have
Princess Zelda found there?

column3:
私 ゼルダ姫の足跡を追ってるんです
次は ラネール山にある知恵の泉を目指します
column4:
I'm retracing Princess Zelda's steps.
Next, I'm off to the Spring of Wisdom
at Mount Lanayru.

column3:
…私も旅の者です
いえ巡礼者というべきかもしれません
ここより少し北を旅していたときでしょうか…
カカリコ村の長に面会できたのは幸運でした
ハイラルの歴史にお詳しく
お人柄も とても素敵な女性でしたよ
column4:
I, too, am a traveler. Or perhaps I should
say \"an adventurer.\" Yes, that's the one.

In fact, I'm in the middle of a journey.
I even had the great honor of meeting
with the leader of Kakariko Village.
She is very knowledgeable of the
history of Hyrule, and she is also
blessed with a lovely personality.

column3:
カカリコ村の長は素敵な女性でした
あなたも お会いになってはいかが？
column4:
The leader of Kakariko Village is a
wonderful woman. If you can,
you should meet with her, as well.

column3:
ここには いにしえの戦いの
名残りが残されています
失われた尊き命の数たるやさぞかし…
column4:
The traces of an ancient battle linger...
Countless precious lives must have been
lost here...

column3:
ここで失われた数々の命…
私は ただ祈る事しかできません
column4:
Just think of all the lives that were
lost here... All we can do now is
pray that their souls found peace.

column3:
大厄災を免れたハテノ村の穏やかさが
じつは どこか危ういものだということ…
旅を通して外の世界を見ているあなたなら
きっと感じていますよね？
column4:
Hateno Village managed to escape the
brunt of the Great Calamity, yet somehow
the peace here feels so precarious...
As one who has traveled and seen so
much of the world, surely you must
feel it too?

column3:
大厄災を免れたハテノ村の危うさ…
あなたも感じますか？
column4:
Hateno Village escaped the brunt of the
Great Calamity, but the peace enjoyed
here feels precarious... Do you feel it?

column3: 今日もどうか無事で…
column4: I'm somehow still safe...

column3: ゼルダ姫…
column4: Princess Zelda...

column3: 巡礼の者です…
column4: I'm an adventurer...

column3: 魔物に遭わぬよう…
column4: Stay away, monsters...

column3: 降ってきました…
column4: It's raining...

column3:
私もあなたと同じ旅の途中…
ただし冒険ではなく巡礼の旅をしています
平和を尊ばれた ゼルダ姫の強き思いが
多くの人々の心に行き渡りますように…
column4:
I am in the midst of a journey, not unlike
you are. Though, to be frank, mine is
more of a pilgrimage.
I do hope that Princess Zelda's devout
prayers for peace will touch the lives
of others as they have touched mine.

column3:
雨の日は巡礼はお休みして
自分を見つめ直す時間なんです
祈る心に迷いはないか
己に嘘をついてはいないか…って
column4:
I take a break from my pilgrimage
whenever it rains. It gives me time
for introspection.
Is my heart truly devoted to prayer?
Am I deceiving myself in any way?
You know, things like that.

column3:
この雨は ハイラルのお城にも
降り注いでいるのでしょうか…
ゼルダ姫のお父様
ハイラル王の御霊を鎮めるかのように…
column4:
I wonder if this same rain is falling on
Hyrule Castle...

May the spirit of King Rhoam,
Princess Zelda's noble father,
be at peace...

column3:
…知恵の泉には もう行かれました？

私の敬愛するゼルダ姫が
祈りのために訪れたという由緒ある泉です
column4:
Have you already been to the
Spring of Wisdom?

It is known that Princess Zelda visited
the spring in prayer. I have a great deal
of love and respect for her.

column3:
知恵の泉は ゼルダ姫ゆかりの地…
ハイラル城の代々の王女が訪れる場所です
column4:
The Spring of Wisdom has strong ties
to Princess Zelda...

It is a place that the princesses of
Hyrule Castle have visited from
generation to generation.

column3:
…あなたの旅の目的はわかりませんが
ぜひ訪れてほしい場所があります
ラネール山の奥深くにある知恵の泉…
私が巡礼地に選んだ由緒ある泉です
column4:
I do not know the purpose of your
journey, but...there is a place that
I recommend you pay a visit to.
Deep in the recesses of Mount Lanayru
lies the Spring of Wisdom... It is a storied
spring to which I am making a pilgrimage.

column3:
ラネール山の知恵の泉…
由緒ある泉ですので訪れてみてはいかが？
column4:
The Spring of Wisdom at Mount Lanayru.
It is a storied spring... You can't tell me
you're not curious. Care to visit it?

column3:
この辺りは古戦場なんですが…

よくある名所旧跡とは違い
かつての戦いを偲ぶ気にはなりません
なぜなら大厄災が完全に終息したという話は
一切伝承されていないので…
column4:
This area was once the site of an
ancient battle...

Unlike other well-known ruins, I don't
think imagining what took place here
would be very satisfying.
The reason I say that is because none of
the old stories about the Great Calamity
mention it being entirely defeated...

column3:
この辺りの古戦場跡…
戦いの名残りが痛々しいですね…
私達に できる事は…
尊き命の為に祈る事だけです…
column4:
An ancient battle took place here...
Even just being near a place so full
of tragic memories is painful.
All we can do...is honor the brave lives
that were lost here...

column3:
ここはガーディアンの進行を食い止めるために
村人たちが築いた砦の跡です…
今私たちがここにいるのは
そのおかげとも言えるでしょう…
column4:
These are the remains of a fortress that
was erected by villagers to try and halt
the advance of the Guardians...
You could safely say the fact that any
of us are alive today is all thanks to
this fortress here.

column3:
ここはガーディアンを食い止めた と言われる砦
私たちは そのおかげで今ここにいるのです…
column4:
This is the fortress said to have
been built to stop the Guardians.
We have it to thank for our lives.

column3:
…旅の最終目的地あなたにはありますか？
私が最後に訪れたいのは知恵の泉です
敬愛するゼルダ姫が そこで何を想ったのか
追体験ができたら いいなと…
column4:
Do you have a final destination in mind
for your journey? The last place I want
to visit is the Spring of Wisdom.
I really want to re-create the journey that
Princess Zelda experienced. I just love
and respect her so very much...

column3:
私の旅の最終目的地は知恵の泉です
そこで ゼルダ姫の面影を追いたいのです
column4:
The final destination of my journey is
the Spring of Wisdom. I hope to feel
Princess Zelda's presence there.

column3: すみません私なんかのために…
column4:
Thank you! Really, I can't believe you
did that for me!

column3: あ…ありがとうございました
column4: Thank you! Thank you so very much!

column3:
あぶないところを助けていただき
お礼の言葉もありません…
column4:
You saved me! I...I don't have the right
words to properly thank you...

column3:
自分の身は自分でと思ってはいても…
ご迷惑 おかけしました
column4:
Because I was so sure I could take care
of myself, I put you in the position of
having to look after me. Heh, sorry!

column3:
助けていただき ありがとうございます
恐ろしくて まだ震えが…
column4:
Thank you for saving me! Wow, that was
so scary. I'm still shaking...

column3:
助けていただき ありがとうございます
あなたの旅の お邪魔をしてしまったかも…
column4:
Thank you for helping me! I'm so sorry
for interrupting your journey...

column3: これは ほんのお礼です
column4: Here. This is a small token of my thanks.
